topics.body: Speaking of metal gear when you get down to it Rex and mechs that style are the only type of fictional mechs that would make any sense in a real life battle cause when you get down to it Rex is a railgun tank with legs.  Rex could totally work on a battlefield cause imagine a tank with legs for latching onto cliff faces and firing from it.  The best any tank can currently do is climb up 75 degree angles, but obviously it can't stay there.  Imagine going through a tunnel and looking up and a enemy tank is on the fucking ceiling looking down at you.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54c32f4c6368724894490600#post_54c32f4c6368724894490600
A tank with legs would be a insane advancement cause think about the Afghanistan war.  It took fucking years to route Al Qaeda out of mountains cause tanks can't climb mountains and such so it gave Al Qaeda a *HUGE* advantage.  A rex style tank with legs would just destroy that advantage.

Chances are though if such a thing were to be made then 95% of the time the tank would be using traditional treads instead and only using the legs in terrain that can't handle it and these types of tanks would only be a small portion of the military.
